pr_title: Show date from which statistics are counting

timeline.message: use PreferenceUpgrader to check if app is on first run

timeline.bodyText: Please revert the unrelated change to keep the git history clean
timeline.author: ByteHamster

timeline.bodyText: Please add something like "date" to the name. It currently sounds like it returns the millis between today and the first install.
timeline.author: ByteHamster

timeline.bodyText: As a safeguard, could you please move this into the .subscribe lambda? If for whatever reason the database call fails, the date should not be reset. I do not think this will ever happen (or if it happens, users will not care) but it feels somehow more clean to only update after it is actually reset.
timeline.author: ByteHamster

timeline.bodyText: Why is this "if" needed? I think the code should only be called on the very first install. We therefore know that the usage stats are not yet counting. Did I miss something?
timeline.author: ByteHamster

replies.bodyText: Yes this is not necessary, but just to be sure ;)
replies.author: asdoi

timeline.bodyText: I would combine set/reset to a single method. Can't think of a case where we want to use set without reset.
timeline.author: ByteHamster

timeline.bodyText: This should also be called when a database is imported.
timeline.author: ByteHamster

replies.bodyText: Thank you. I forgot this, but should not be the date set to -1 (unset) because we do not know the date the new statistics were counted since?
replies.author: asdoi
